get.summary: Read configuration of Authentication Server Group
get.description:
Allow you to manage a configured authentication server to an ordered list in a server group, for AP and GW you can configure server rules to derive a user role,
VLAN ID or VLAN name from attributes returned by the server during authentication.
For CX, A maximum of 32 AAA server-groups are supported. Out of these four are default server-groups (local, none, radius, tacacs) and the rest 28 can be user configured.
For AP, A maximum of 16 AAA server-groups are supported for per device. And all server-groups can be user configured.
This feature is applicable for all devices.

post.summary: Create a new Authentication Server Group profile by unique name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Server Group.For CX, maximum length is 32 characters.

get.summary: Read existing Authentication Server Group profile configuration

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Server Group.For CX, maximum length is 32 characters.

patch.summary: Update existing Authentication Server Group profile configuration

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Server Group.For CX, maximum length is 32 characters.

delete.summary: Delete the Authentication Server Group profile

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Server Group.For CX, maximum length is 32 characters.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaAuthServerGroup_ServerGroupsSchema.description:
Allow you to manage a configured authentication server to an ordered list in a server group, for AP and GW you can configure server rules to derive a user role,
VLAN ID or VLAN name from attributes returned by the server during authentication.
For CX, A maximum of 32 AAA server-groups are supported. Out of these four are default server-groups (local, none, radius, tacacs) and the rest 28 can be user configured.
For AP, A maximum of 16 AAA server-groups are supported for per device. And all server-groups can be user configured.
This feature is applicable for all devices.

name.description: The name of the Server Group.For CX, maximum length is 32 characters.

type.description: Auth Server Group Type. CX supports server group types RADIUS and TACACS and configuring this parameter is mandatory while creating a Server Group.

load-balance.description: Enable load-balancing of authentication requests among different servers in a server group.

fail-through.description:
When this option is configured, an authentication failure with the first server in the group causes the device to attempt authentication
with the next server in the list. The device attempts authentication with each server in the ordered list until either there is a successful
authentication or the list of servers in the group is exhausted.

servers.description: Configure the servers in the server group in a specific order based on their position within the group.

server-name.description:
The name of the Server to be associated to the Server Group.
For CX, maximum of 4 servers can be associated to a RADIUS Server Group and maximum of 1 server can be associated to a TACACS Server Group.

position.description: Position of auth-server, where default is bottom, 1 is top.

operator-match-string-match-type.description: Key combination of match-type,operator and match-string separated by ~

x-enumDescriptions.FQDN: Match type to a FQDN string.

match-type.x-typeDescription: Match type for server rules in server-group.
match-type.description:
Match authentication type for server rules in server-group. When the match-type is FQDN, the operator has to be NONE.
When the match-type is AUTHSTRING, the operator can be one of the 3 only: CONTAINS, EQUALS or STARTS-WITH.

x-enumDescriptions.CONTAINS: Match when authstring contains the sub-string.
x-enumDescriptions.EQUALS: Match when authstring is equal to the sub-string
x-enumDescriptions.STARTS_WITH: Match when authstring starts-with the sub-string

operator.x-typeDescription: Match authentication string to select next auth-server
operator.description:
Match authentication string to select next auth-server. When the match-type is AUTHSTRING, the operator can be one of the 3 only: CONTAINS, EQUALS or STARTS-WITH.
When the match-type is FQDN, the operator has to be NONE.

match-string.description: Substring to match in the auth string or the FQDN string (maximum 63 characters).

trim-fqdn.description: Trim FQDN from username before sending to server.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

name.description: The name of the Server Group.For CX, maximum length is 32 characters.

type.description: Auth Server Group Type. CX supports server group types RADIUS and TACACS and configuring this parameter is mandatory while creating a Server Group.

load-balance.description: Enable load-balancing of authentication requests among different servers in a server group.

fail-through.description:
When this option is configured, an authentication failure with the first server in the group causes the device to attempt authentication
with the next server in the list. The device attempts authentication with each server in the ordered list until either there is a successful
authentication or the list of servers in the group is exhausted.

servers.description: Configure the servers in the server group in a specific order based on their position within the group.

server-name.description:
The name of the Server to be associated to the Server Group.
For CX, maximum of 4 servers can be associated to a RADIUS Server Group and maximum of 1 server can be associated to a TACACS Server Group.

position.description: Position of auth-server, where default is bottom, 1 is top.

operator-match-string-match-type.description: Key combination of match-type,operator and match-string separated by ~

x-enumDescriptions.FQDN: Match type to a FQDN string.

match-type.x-typeDescription: Match type for server rules in server-group.
match-type.description:
Match authentication type for server rules in server-group. When the match-type is FQDN, the operator has to be NONE.
When the match-type is AUTHSTRING, the operator can be one of the 3 only: CONTAINS, EQUALS or STARTS-WITH.

x-enumDescriptions.CONTAINS: Match when authstring contains the sub-string.
x-enumDescriptions.EQUALS: Match when authstring is equal to the sub-string
x-enumDescriptions.STARTS_WITH: Match when authstring starts-with the sub-string

operator.x-typeDescription: Match authentication string to select next auth-server
operator.description:
Match authentication string to select next auth-server. When the match-type is AUTHSTRING, the operator can be one of the 3 only: CONTAINS, EQUALS or STARTS-WITH.
When the match-type is FQDN, the operator has to be NONE.

match-string.description: Substring to match in the auth string or the FQDN string (maximum 63 characters).

trim-fqdn.description: Trim FQDN from username before sending to server.

assignment-rules.description:
Assign the client a user role, VLAN ID or VLAN name based on attributes. For GW and AP, the attributes is returned for the client by the authentication server and this API is applicable for
auth server group. For AP, this API is also applicable WLAN profile and if this API works in WLAN profile, the attributes can be returned for the client by the authentication server or other
attributes such as mac-address, dhcp-option, AP-Name, etc. Rules are ordered: the first rule that matches the configured condition is applied. VLAN IDs and VLAN names cannot be listed together.
This feature is only applicable for AP and GW.

sequence-id.description: The sequence id determines the rule order.

attribute.description:
Attribute returned by the authentication server.
For AP, it also includes some custom attributes like mac-address, dhcp-option and fw_mode.

operand.description:
Match operand, For GW, the VSA value. For AP, it is VSA value under server group profile.
It is VSA value and mac-addrees, dhcp-option and fw_mode under SSID profile and AP wired port profile.

vlan.description: This is the assigned VLAN when there is a rule match.

role.description: This is the assigned Role when there is a rule match.

ArubaRadiusModifiers_AttributeProfile.description:
This feature is to provide configuration commands to the user to include specific attributes in these access-request and the corresponding values of these attributes.
Including these attributes in access-request packets helps administrators assign appropriate access policies to the clients based on these attributes.

x-enumDescriptions.STATIC: Native VLAN of the client port.
x-enumDescriptions.DYNAMIC: VLAN assigned to the client by authentication server.

nas-identifier.description:
Configure the Network Access Switch Identifier.NAS-Id will be sent in RADIUS access-request and accounting packets, which is used to notify
the source of RADIUS access request. NAS-Id can be a FQDN of the NAS or any unique string to identify the NAS.

request-type.description: RADIUS request type for NAS Identifier.

nas-ip-address.description:
Configuration to include Network Access Switch IP Address attribute in RADIUS access request packet.
By default NAS-IP-Address attribute will not be added in authentication or accounting packet for management users.
Both request-type and service-type should be set to include the NAS-IP-Address Attribute.

x-enumDescriptions.BOTH: Management users and port-access clients authentication/accounting.

service-type.description: RADIUS service type for NAS-IP-Address. This field can only be set if service-type is MANAGEMENT.

framed-ip-address.description:
This command enables the inclusion of the RADIUS attribute Framed-IP-Address (type 8) in RADIUS access request packets for port-access clients.
By default, the IP address assigned to the client is not included in the RADIUS access request packets. They are however included in the accounting packets.

request-type.description: RADIUS request type for Framed-IP-Address. This field can only be set if request-type is AUTHENTICATION.

x-enumDescriptions.BOTH: Management users and port-access clients authentication/accounting.

service-type.description: RADIUS service type for Framed-IP-Address. This field can only be set if service-type is PORT_ACCESS.

vsa.description: This configuration allows a user to include specific VSAs in RADIUS request packets for different service types.

vendor-vsa-type.description: Key combination of vendor and vsa-type separated by ~

vendor.description: Name of the vendor, vsa-type and vsa-value must also be configured.

vsa-type.x-typeDescription: RADIUS VSA vendor specific attribute type.
vsa-type.description: RADIUS VSA type, vendor and vsa-value must also be configured.

vsa-value.x-typeDescription: Value of RADIUS vendor specific attribute value pair.
vsa-value.description: RADIUS VSA value, vendor and vsa-type must also be configured.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
